data.boring_theme: going to the petrol station to pump diesel into a vehicle
data.output: As the day grows darker And I find myself having to do the weekly shopping it is with glee that I look over my shoulder whilst driving past a petrol pump. What a relic of the recent past, having had to put diesel in my old car and feeling like a slave to the big oil corporations that are stuck in their ways. Nowadays, I go shopping whilst my electric car charges, giving me time and not worrying what my actions impact our environment. To all the naysayers I say just this, don't wack it before you try it.
data.original_output: As the day grows darker and I find myself having to do the weekly shopping it is with glee that I look over my shoulder whilst driving past a petrol pump. What a relic of the recent past, having had to put diesel in my old car and feeling like a slave to the big oil corporations that are stuck in their ways. Nowadays, I go shopping whilst my electric car charges, giving me time and not worrying what my actions impact our environment. To all the naysayers I say just this, don't wack it before you try it.

data.boring_theme: putting a stamp on the envelop containing a letter to send it
data.output: There is something special about writing a letter, a real letter, not an email or a text message. Taking the time to sit down, place a sheet of paper on my desk, choose from one of my favourite pens and just write whilst sipping a cup of coffee. The bit I like best is the satisfaction of inserting the letter in an envelope, licking the glue, sealing it and then choose a stamp from my collection that I know the recipient will like. I get up, put my shoes on, take my letter and go on a walk around the local park until I spot the very unusual letterbox where a tree has grown to engulf it And I send my letter by posting it through the red letterbox. If this isn't slow living to enjoy the present I don't know what is.
data.original_output: There is something special about writing a letter, a real letter, not an email or a text message. Taking the time to sit down, place a sheet of paper on my desk, choose from one of my favourite pens and just write whilst sipping a cup of coffee. The bit I like best is the satisfaction of inserting the letter in an envelope, licking the glue, sealing it and then choose a stamp from my collection that I know the recipient will like. I get up, put my shoes on, take my letter and go on a walk around the local park until I spot the very unusual letterbox where a tree has grown to engulf it and I send my letter by posting it through the red letterbox. If this isn't slow living to enjoy the present I don't know what is.

data.boring_theme: having an organ empire and complying with regulations
data.output: In the distant British Empire it used to be law that whenever someone stole a sack of salt they would be arrested and had to choose an organ they had to sacrifice. No one ever chose a hand, they'd ask for an ear or a kidney but never a hand. There was no choice, they had to comply because resisting would mean sure death. This is the story of how salt became one of the most common seasonings in the world.

data.boring_theme: the feeling of gloom you have about an existing payment
data.output: We exist to pay, that is modern day gloom for each and everyone of us. Without access to money interactions and payments humans wouldn't be able to have created the society as we have it now where each of us make such transactions on a daily basis. Only the lucky ones are able to go a day without paying for something.
